alert.note: Alert for Central Douglas County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Freeze Warning issued April 14 at 12:11PM PDT until April 15 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 9 AM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures of 26 to 32 degrees expected. * WHERE...Mainly outlying areas of Central Douglas County, including Sutherlin, Green, Myrtle Creek, Camas Valley, Tri- City, Riddle and Canyonville. * WHEN...From 1 AM to 9 AM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Frost and freezing conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is a cold air mass, so wind machines will have little additional benefit. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
